@tobajas I'm pretty sure it was just one really successful doujin, that many other people just take and then reproduce it. This is no surprise in the industry of manga/anime. most of the top ones are based on a reproduced piece or work. its probably never meant to be realistic. if it was, people would probably be way more critical of it in the first place, regardless of its intent. i agree the ntr scene is kinda dull and stale right now, everything is one-dimensional. But this is because its just vanilla ntr. if you want something more out there, you're gonna end up noticing they have their own genre that goes well beyond ntr. its not a very big genre, but its full of regurgitated work. Probably just used as a stepping stone so people can get their artwork noticed and move on to bigger projects that actually require a lot of time and effort.
